00048 void NTee::startChildProc() {
00049 
00050    //** Replace any @NTEEPORT values in R_cmd with the actual port number
00051    char** ptr = &s_.R_cmd[1];
00052    while( *ptr ) {
00053       if ( strcmp( *ptr, "@NTEEPORT" ) == 0 )
00054          snprintf( *ptr, 9,"%d",srvPort_);
00055       else if ( strcmp( *ptr, "@NTEESERVERADDR" ) == 0 )
00056          snprintf( *ptr, 15, serverhost_.c_str());
00057 
00058       ++ptr;
00059    }
00060 
00061    //** Start the client.
00062    pid_t pid;
00063    if ( (pid=fork()) == 0 ) {
00064       // in the child.
00065       SysErrIf( execvp( s_.R_cmd[0], s_.R_cmd ) == -1 );
00066    }
00067    SysErrIf( pid == -1 ).info("Unable to fork properly\n");
00068 }

00080 Socket NTee::constructService( sockaddr_in* psa, socklen_t* plen )
00081 {
00082    Socket sock;
00083    int type = (s_.protocol==Settings::TCP)? SOCK_STREAM : SOCK_DGRAM;   
00084    SysErrIf( (sock=socket(AF_INET, type, 0 )) == -1 );
00085 
00086    // Here we set the close-on-exec flag for the socket, because we don't want
00087    // it to carry over to the client process.
00088    SysErrIf( fcntl( sock, F_SETFD, FD_CLOEXEC ) == -1 );
00089    
00090    // Set up the internet address and port 
00091    memset( psa, 0, *plen);
00092    psa->sin_family = AF_INET;
00093    psa->sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(INADDR_ANY);
00094    psa->sin_port = htons(s_.srv_port);  // 0 is the wildcard port
00095    SysErrIf( bind(sock, reinterpret_cast<sockaddr*>(psa),
00096                   *plen) == -1);
00097 
00098    // Get values for whatever the kernel decided to bind us to.
00099    SysErrIf( getsockname(sock, reinterpret_cast<sockaddr*>(psa),
00100                          plen) == -1 );
00101 
00102    char buf[INET_ADDRSTRLEN];
00103    inet_ntop(AF_INET, psa, buf, *plen);
00104    std::cout << "Server on: " << buf 
00105              << ":" << ntohs(psa->sin_port) << "\n"; 
00106 
00107    //** Save the server port that was assigned and the host address  
00108    serverhost_.assign(buf);
00109    srvPort_ = ntohs(psa->sin_port);
00110 
00111    
00112    // magic # 5 is just what most examples use.
00113    SysErrIf( listen(sock,5) == -1 );
00114    
00115    return sock;
00116 }

00133 int NTee::start()
00134 {
00135    //** Build up the service port.
00136    sockaddr_in addr;
00137    socklen_t len = sizeof(addr);
00138    Socket sock = constructService( &addr, &len );
00139    
00140    //** Not going to accept yet! Instead, we start the client.
00141    startChildProc();
00142          
00143    // Back in the parent (ntee) otherwise we'd have exited.
00144    Socket Rsock;
00145    SysErrIf( (Rsock=accept(sock, reinterpret_cast<sockaddr*>(&addr),
00146                              &len)) == -1 );
00147       
00148    // Report the client connection.
00149    char buf[INET_ADDRSTRLEN];
00150    inet_ntop(AF_INET, &addr, buf, sizeof(addr));   
00151    std::cout << "Client connection: " << buf
00152              << ":" << ntohs(addr.sin_port) << "\n";
00153    
00154    //** R process has connected... time to connect to the L process.
00155    Socket Lsock;
00156    int type = (s_.protocol==Settings::TCP)? SOCK_STREAM : SOCK_DGRAM;   
00157    SysErrIf( (Lsock=socket(AF_INET, type, 0 )) == -1 );
00158 
00159    // Set up the internet address and port 
00160    memset(&addr, 0, sizeof(addr));
00161    SysErrIf( inet_pton(AF_INET, s_.L_host_ip.c_str(),
00162                        reinterpret_cast<sockaddr*>(&addr)) <= 0 );
00163    addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
00164    addr.sin_port = htons(s_.L_port);
00165 
00166    SysErrIf( connect(Lsock, reinterpret_cast<sockaddr*>(&addr),
00167                      sizeof(addr)) == -1 );
00168                        
00169    std::cout << "NTee connected to L side: " << s_.L_host_ip << ":"
00170              << s_.L_port << "\n";
00171              
00172    return 0;
00173 }
